abstract: JPMorgan Chase acknowledged that new rules passed last year curbing the banks’ ability to charge its banking and credit card customers certain fees and penalties would cut into its bottom line more than it had expected.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase acknowledged that new rules passed last year curbing the banks’ ability to charge its banking and credit card customers certain fees and penalties would cut into its bottom line more than it had expected.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase acknowledged Thursday that new rules passed last year curbing the banks’ ability to charge its banking and credit card customers certain fees and penalties would cut into its bottom line more than it had expected.

headline.main: JPMorgan Feels Bigger Pinch From Rules on Fees
